reference.title: Emulator Language dialog
reference.shortdesc: Changes the emulated device's configuration to a locale that you specify as a combination of language and region (or country). Note that this operation causes the emulator to restart.

section.p: This function (accessible by right-clicking a running emulator from the Device Management view and selecting Language) changes the emulator settings to the selected locale using setprop persist adb shell commands. The emulator is then restarted so that the settings can take effect. Note that not all emulators support all of the listed languages and countries; if you select an unsupported locale the system displays using its default language. However, your application should localize based upon the selected locale.
A locale is specified as a combination of language and region (or country).

strow.stentry: The language the device should use. Select from the provided list of languages.
The region that uses the desired language. Select from the provided list.

refbody.section: Note that you can instead change the emulator's locale using the Custom Locale application that is accessible from the Application tab on the emulated device.
